DOC.brief_summary: To study the effects of zinc supplement on anthropometric factors, Apelin and inflammatory markers in obese individuals, 50 obes person who referred to Diet and Nutrition clinic of Shahid Beheshti University of Medical Sciences will be randomly allocated to receive 50 mg zinc capsules or placebos for 15 weeks; both groups will be advised to adherence the investigators' diet . At the first and the end of the intervention,weight, body mass index (BMI), waist circumference, fat mass and lean body mass, concentration of zinc, albumin, hs-CRP, TNF-Î± and plasma apelin will be assessed and compared between groups.
DOC.brief_title: Effects of Zinc Supplementation on Anthropometric Factors, Apelin and Inflammatory Markers in Obese Individuals
DOC.criteria: Age of 18 to 45 years Nonsmoking Body Mass Index (BMI) more than 30 Pregnancy, lactation or menopause in women History of liver disease, kidney, thyroid, diabetes and other metabolic diseases Use of drugs interfering with lipid profile, bloodthinning drugs, betablockers Patients with immune deficiency Use of zinc, calcium and iron supplement in the last 2 months Use of weight loss medication or special diet Following program to lose weight in recent 2 months Recent surgery
